isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built Starting March 1, 2007 - CB and 2-Way Radio Accommodation Packages - 08REA and 08RGA - 2-Way Radio

svcproc.title: 08REA and 08RGA - 2-Way Radio
svcproc.para: Refer to the Circuit Diagram Manual S08322, Chapter 4, Cab Accessories, 2-Way Radio.
08REA - 2-WAY RADIO Wiring Effects; Wiring With 20 AMP Fuse Protection, Includes IGN Wire With 5 AMP Fuse, Wire Ends Heat Shrink and 10' Coil Taped to Base Harness
08RGA - 2-WAY RADIO Wiring Effects; Wiring With 20 AMP Fuse Protection, Includes IGN Wire With 5 AMP Fuse, Wire Ends Heat Shrink and Routed to Center of Header Console in Cab

08REA - Feature code 08REA provides a fused 20 AMP battery feed power wire, GND wire and fused 5 AMP IGN feed for applications requiring two-way radio communications such as local municipal government units or state DOT highway maintenance vehicles. The three wires are taped to the main cab harness.

08RGA - Feature code 08RGA provides a fused 20 AMP battery feed power wire, GND wire and fused 5 AMP IGN feed for applications requiring two-way radio communications such as local municipal government units or state DOT highway maintenance vehicles. The three wires are located in the center of the header console in the cab.
SOFTWARE FEATURE CODES / PROGRAMMABLE PARAMETERS: NONE

Locations for connecting to the vehicle IGN have been provided. The table below lists the connection point along with information about that point. For a complete diagram of the IGN system and for connector and terminal part numbers, see vehicle circuit diagram manual.
08REA and 08RGA provide radio power and GND directly from the battery to minimize electrical noise on the line.
The cable is coiled up under the Instrument Panel (IP) as shown above in 08REA, and is of sufficient length to route to the back of the Travelcrew cab.
The wiring is located in the center of the header console in the cab for 08RGA.
• To test these circuits, refer to the applicable circuit diagram for the feature and verify that battery voltage is present in the correct key-state for each respective feature.

If the vehicle was ordered without one of the desired features, it can be installed in the field. Refer to the " How Do I" General Information section of this electrical guide for information on obtaining required parts. The same parts that are used in the OEM installation are available (cables, components, etc.). Also, refer to the circuit diagram that applies to the vehicle to aid in the installation.
